title: Upward Salute
description: Primary body parts engaged Stretches torso, aligns spine How to perform Upward Salute Stand with your feet together. Allow your arms to hang by your sides. Reach the crown of your head toward the sky. Point your tailbone toward the floor. Reach your arms out and up with an inhale, bringing your palms to touch overhead. Gaze diagonally upward. Relax your shoulders downward. Engage your core and thighs and lift your kneecaps up. Hold the pose and take slow, deep breaths.
alignment_cues: Maintain steady breath throughout the pose
Keep proper alignment based on pose type
Listen to your body and modify as needed
